definition: great uncle/grandfather's younger brother/husband's father's younger brother
uncle/father's younger brother/husband's younger brother/Taiwan pr. [shu2]

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: He was the youngest son of the youngest grand uncle of Ari.
sentences.chinese: 他是雅俐的最小叔公的最小兒子。

sentences.english: MeiYiHe answer the four great uncles please, MeiXianZu escaped the family the robbery.
sentences.chinese: 梅乙鶴應允了四叔公之請，梅賢祖逃過了家法這一劫。

definition: grandfather's sister/sister of a woman's father-in-law
father's elder brother/term of respect for older man/CL:個|个[ge4]
(of cousins) descending from the same grandfather or great-grandfather
aunt by marriage/husband's aunt/husband's father's younger brother's wife
(respectful for) one's grandfather/sb's father/older people/the head of the house (used by servants)/a district magistrate
wife of father's elder brother/aunt/(polite form of address for a woman who is about the age of one's mother)/CL:個|个[ge4]
mother's sister's husband/husband of mother's sister
uncle (affectionate name for a friend older than one's father)/old friend
(coll.) old man/(said of an aging husband) my old man
